trans-unit.source: When used outside stored routines, the USER, CURRENT_USER, and SESSION_USER functions all return the authorization identifier of the user that created the SQL session.

seg-source.mrk: When used outside stored routines, the USER, CURRENT_USER, and SESSION_USER functions all return the authorization identifier of the user that created the SQL session.

target.mrk: When used outside stored routines, the USER, CURRENT_USER, and SESSION_USER functions all return the authorization identifier of the user that created the SQL session.

trans-unit.source: See <xref href="rrefsqlj42324.dita#rrefsqlj42324"></xref> and <xref href="rrefsqlj25228.dita#rrefsqlj25228"></xref> for details on those functions.

seg-source.mrk: See <xref href="rrefsqlj42324.dita#rrefsqlj42324"></xref> and <xref href="rrefsqlj25228.dita#rrefsqlj25228"></xref> for details on those functions.

target.mrk: See <xref href="rrefsqlj42324.dita#rrefsqlj42324"></xref> and <xref href="rrefsqlj25228.dita#rrefsqlj25228"></xref> for details on those functions.

trans-unit.source: SESSION_USER also always returns this value when used within stored routines.

seg-source.mrk: SESSION_USER also always returns this value when used within stored routines.

target.mrk: SESSION_USER also always returns this value when used within stored routines.

trans-unit.source: If used within a stored routine created with EXTERNAL SECURITY DEFINER, however, USER and CURRENT_USER return the authorization identifier of the user that owns the schema of the routine. This is usually the creating user, although the database owner could be the creator as well.

seg-source.mrk: If used within a stored routine created with EXTERNAL SECURITY DEFINER, however, USER and CURRENT_USER return the authorization identifier of the user that owns the schema of the routine.
This is usually the creating user, although the database owner could be the creator as well.

target.mrk: If used within a stored routine created with EXTERNAL SECURITY DEFINER, however, USER and CURRENT_USER return the authorization identifier of the user that owns the schema of the routine.
This is usually the creating user, although the database owner could be the creator as well.

trans-unit.source: For information about definer's and invoker's rights, see <xref href="rrefcreateprocedurestatement.dita#rrefcreateprocedurestatement"></xref> or <xref href="rrefcreatefunctionstatement.dita#rrefcreatefunctionstatement"></xref>.

seg-source.mrk: For information about definer's and invoker's rights, see <xref href="rrefcreateprocedurestatement.dita#rrefcreateprocedurestatement"></xref> or <xref href="rrefcreatefunctionstatement.dita#rrefcreatefunctionstatement"></xref>.

target.mrk: For information about definer's and invoker's rights, see <xref href="rrefcreateprocedurestatement.dita#rrefcreateprocedurestatement"></xref> or <xref href="rrefcreatefunctionstatement.dita#rrefcreatefunctionstatement"></xref>.
